meanings.definition: Unable to be atoned for or forgiven.
meanings.sent1: The crime he committed was inexpiable, and he could not find forgiveness.
meanings.sent2: Her inexpiable actions left a permanent mark on her reputation.
meanings.sent3: The cat's inexpiable curiosity led it into all sorts of trouble.
meanings.sent4: The inexpiable debt of gratitude he owed to his mentor weighed heavily on his conscience.
meanings.sent5: The inexpiable betrayal shattered their friendship beyond repair.

meanings.definition: Incapable of being redeemed or absolved.
meanings.sent1: The consequences of his actions were inexpiable, and he had to face them.
meanings.sent2: The criminal's inexpiable guilt haunted him every day.
meanings.sent3: The inexpiable stain on the carpet proved impossible to remove.
meanings.sent4: Her inexpiable anger towards him never seemed to fade.
meanings.sent5: The inexpiable loss of her favorite necklace left her heartbroken.

meanings.definition: Not able to be expiated or forgiven.
meanings.sent1: The priest explained that some sins are inexpiable in the eyes of the church.
meanings.sent2: The soldier carried the burden of his inexpiable mistake with him for the rest of his life.
meanings.sent3: The inexpiable error in the report caused a lot of confusion.
meanings.sent4: The inexpiable debt he owed to his friend strained their relationship.
meanings.sent5: The inexpiable nature of the crime shocked the entire community.
